results.title: Chapter and verse
results.creator_credit: Paul Rotha, Strand Films, National Book Council and Stanley Hawes
results.brief_description: The history of printing is traced from its beginning to modern methods of large scale production in English Publishing Houses and the distribution and marketing of the finished book. At the same time, the film follows the life of an individual book, beginning with the author’s MS, the reading of the proofs, the printing, binding, sale to shops and final use in libraries where it is indexed and catalogued.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Rotha, Strand Films, National Book Council and Stanley Hawes

results.title: Chaplin: a character is born
results.creator_credit: S-L Film Productions and Gerald A Schiller
results.brief_description: Narrated by Keenan Wynn, this film briefly traces Chaplin’s early life, his days with the Fred Karne vaudeville troupe and his film career up until the time he left Mutual Studios at the end of 1917. Extracts from many of Chaplin’s important early films are shown, including “Making a living” (1914), “Kid auto races at Venice” (1914), “The Vagabond” (1916), “the Pawnshop” (1916), “The Rink” (1916), “Easy Street” (1917), “The Immigrant” (1917) and “The Adventurer” (1917).
results.creator_credit_for_label: S-L Film Productions and Gerald A Schiller

results.title: Chaplin (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Richard Attenborough and Mario Kassar
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking are inextricably linked and brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film features one of the finest casts from the world of film and includes: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour cherished by all.

results.title: Chaplin's first films
results.brief_description: A selection of Chaplin’s early films illustrating the development of his art form from slapstick to a subtle mixture of pathos and comedy. Excerpts from the following are included in this compilation: “Some Nerve”, “Making a Living”, “Mabel’s Strange Predicament”, “Tillie’s Punctured Romance”, “His Prehistoric Past”, “The Champion” and “The Tramp”.

results.title: Chaplin
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Richard Attenborough and Mario Kassar
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking - inextricably linked together - are brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film starring one of the finest casts from the world of film including: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour which everyone, everywhere cherished.

results.title: Chapelcross: Scotland's first nuclear power station
results.brief_description: Shows features of the construction of Chapelcross nuclear power station - the first to be built in Scotland. Presented in a style suitable for non-technical audiences, concentrating on the civil engineering work involved in the construction. Scenes of the official opening ceremony are also included.

results.title: Chaos
results.brief_description: What makes the weather so unpredictable and volatile? Why do epidemics come and go without any discernible pattern and why do social systems, like the Stock Exchange, suffer catastrophic collapses? Could these phenomena ever be predicted? The answer may lie in an exciting mathematical theory - the Chaos Theory - put forward by an intrepid group of mathematicians and physicist. Chaos provides clues to the way in which the universe can seem both ordered and disordered at the same time. This video describes the constituent segments of the Chaos Theory and its practical applications in the real world.

results.title: Channelling baby
results.creator_credit: Caterina De Nave, Oceania Parker Films, New Zealand Film Commission and Christine Parker
results.brief_description: 1971—New Zealand soldiers are heading off to Vietnam amidst hordes of peace protesters and the heady excitement of a solar eclipse. In a column of soldiers stopped to board a military truck, Geoff catches sight of Bunnie, a beautiful hippy whose glorious, intimate smile is the lasting vision he takes with him to war. Destiny brings the pair together a second time, when Geoff returns from Vietnam a few months later. Each has been badly hurt in different ways, but in spite of their personal damage, they fall instantly and passionately in love. They start a life together and Bunnie gives birth to a baby girl. Their lives should be joyously complete, but one day, Geoff and the baby mysteriously disappear, leaving Bunnie devastated. Years later, in the 1990s, Bunnie accepts help from Cassandra, a young woman who claims to be a clairvoyant, to find out what has become of her child. Cassandra brings the couple back together again to solve the mystery of what really happened. Their memories are startlingly different, but pieced together, the truth emerges, bringing escalating consequences. Cast includes Danielle Cormack, Kevin Smith, Amber Sainsbury and Joel Tobeck.
